answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!“Lymph nodes can become swollen from infection, inflammatory conditions, an abscess, or cancer. Other causes of enlarged lymph nodes are rare. By far, the most common cause of swollen lymph nodes is infection.When swelling appears suddenly and is painful, it is usually caused by injury or an infection. Enlargement that comes on gradually and painlessly may, in some cases, result from cancer or a tumor.”In your case it could be due to seborrhagic dermatitis. There is no cure as such, but it can be controlled by medicated shampoos and lotions. Lemon water rise, crusher garlic and peppercorns heated with oil and applied overnight and washed next day with mild shampoo should be tried.You say that you itch a lot. Seborrhagic dermatitis causes itch in the head area. However if you itch all over then you must look at other causes like dry skin, hypothyroidism, diabetes and allergy to soaps, shampoos etc.A tissue biopsy of the scab and underlying tissue may be required to reach a diagnosis.Hope this helps. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!Refer: http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/003097.htm

question: I have swollen lymph nodes all over my head. Some just appear and none get better. I have been treated with antibotics but that didn't help. My head is so itchy. I have been treated with every know anti itch cream, shampoo and lotion. Sometime my whole body itchies. It is coming from within. I have been to 2 emergency rooms, 23 walk in clinics and a dermatologist but still it goes on. What kind of doctor do I call.
title: Swollen Lymph nodes
